definitions: either of two giant conifers with thick fibrous bark, native to California and Oregon. They are the tallest known trees and are among the largest living organisms.

notes.text: Two species in the family Taxodiaceae: the California redwood or coast redwood (Sequoia sempervirens), which can grow to a height of 325 feet (110 m), and the giant redwood (Sequoiadendron giganteum), which can reach a trunk diameter of 35 feet (11 m)

shortDefinitions: giant conifer native to California and Oregon

definitions: used in names of other, chiefly tropical, trees with reddish timber.
shortDefinitions: used in names of several chiefly tropical trees with reddish timber
